alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:28PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cherokee County through 300 PM CDT... At 228 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eastern Weiss Lake, or over Cedar Bluff. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Gaylesville, Tennala, Cornwall Furnace Park, Western Weiss Lake, Eastern Weiss Lake, Moshat, Weiss Dam, Yellow Creek Falls, Chesnut Bay Resort and Howells Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
